intro: Hapalochilus collinus, commonly known as the New Zealand rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native environment. Hapalochilus collinus is often found in coastal and alpine regions, where it thrives in full sun and well-drained soil.
